sen.j: 琵琶湖線（びわこせん）は、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）東海道本線京都駅～米原駅間と北陸本線米原駅～長浜駅間の愛称である。
sen.e: Biwako Line is the name of the train line between Kyoto Station and Maibara Station of Tokaido Main Line, and also between Maibara Station and Nagahama Station of Hokuriku Main Line, both run by West Japan Railway Company. (JR West Japan)

The Biwako Line is the name of the train line between Kyoto Station and Maibara Station of the Tokaido Main Line, and also between Maibara Station and Nagahama Station of the Hokuriku Main Line, both of which are run by West Japan Railway Company (JR West Japan).

The Biwako Line is the name of the train line that runs between Kyoto Station and Maibara Station of the Tokaido Main Line, and also between Maibara Station and Nagahama Station of the Hokuriku Main Line, both of which are run by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: ラインカラーは青（■）。
sen.e: The line color is blue.
The line color is blue.
The line color is blue.

sen.j: JR発足後、1988年3月13日に路線愛称が定められた時、京都～米原間もJR京都線と名付けられたが、地元や当時の滋賀県知事から地域密着の路線名にして欲しいとの要望があったため、翌1989年に再度命名した。
sen.e: After JR was established, the name of the line between Kyoto and Maibara was also decided to be called JR Kyoto Line on 13th March 1988, however it was re-named in 1989 as there was a strong demand from the local community and governor of Shiga Prefecture to have more localized name.

After JR was established, on March 13, 1988 it was decided that the name of the line between Kyoto and Maibara would be JR Kyoto Line; however, it was renamed in 1989 since there was strong demand from the local community and governor of Shiga Prefecture to have a more localized name.

After JR was established, on March 13, 1988 it was decided that the name of the line between Kyoto and Maibara would be JR Kyoto Line; however, it was renamed in 1989 since there was strong demand from the local community and governor of Shiga Prefecture to have a more localized name.

sen.j: 北陸本線の米原～長浜間は、1991年9月に田村駅～長浜間が交流電化から直流電化に変更された際に琵琶湖線に加えられたが、2006年10月に直流電化に変更された同線の長浜～敦賀駅間は琵琶湖線に加えられていない。
sen.e: The sector between Maibara and Nagahama of Hokuriku Main Line was added to Biwako Line when between Tamura Staion and Nagahama sector was changed from AC electrification to DC electrification in September 1991, however the same line between Nagahama and Tsuruga sector which was changed to DC electrification in October 2006 was not added to Biwako Line.

The section between Maibara and Nagahama of the Hokuriku Main Line was added to the Biwako Line when the section between Tamura Station and Nagahama was changed from AC electrification to DC electrification in September 1991; however, the same line between Nagahama and the Tsuruga section, which was changed to DC electrification in October 2006, was not added to the Biwako Line.

The section between Maibara and Nagahama of the Hokuriku Main Line was added to the Biwako Line when the section between Tamura Station and Nagahama was changed from AC electrification to DC electrification in September 1991; however, the same line between Nagahama and Tsuruga Station, which was changed to DC electrification in October 2006, was not added to the Biwako Line.

sen.j: なお、東海旅客鉄道の車内放送においては、新幹線ではアーバンネットワークの愛称線名を使用しないが、大垣駅方面から米原駅に到着する普通列車では京都方面の電車に対してのみ「琵琶湖線」と案内することもある。
sen.e: In an announcement of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), especially bullet trains the train line name of the Urban Network is not being used however in local limited trains towards Kyoto (between Ogaki Station and Maibara Station) it is called "Biwako Line".

In an announcement of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), especially bullet trains the train line name of the Urban Network is not being used however in local limited trains towards Kyoto (between Ogaki Station and Maibara Station) it is called "Biwako Line".

In the trains of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), especially on Shinkansen (bullet trains), the train line name of the Urban Network is not being announced; however in local trains that run from Ogaki Station to Maibara Station, the train that run toward the direction of Kyoto is announced as 'Biwako Line.'

sen.j: また、米原駅構内の案内でも大垣方面は「東海道線」、京都方面は「琵琶湖線」と案内されている。
sen.e: Also the announcement inside Maibara Station, the train line towards Ogaki is called 'Central Japan Railway Company' and the line towards Kyoto is called 'Biwako Line'.
Also the announcement inside Maibara Station, the train line towards Ogaki is called 'Central Japan Railway Company' and the line towards Kyoto is called 'Biwako Line'.
Also the announcement inside Maibara Station, the train line towards Ogaki is called 'Tokaido Line' and the line towards Kyoto is called 'Biwako Line.'

sen.j: 京都～草津間は複々線で、外側の2線（外側線）は主として優等列車、貨物列車が使用し、内側の2線（内側線）は新快速・普通が利用している。
sen.e: The rail track between Kyoto and Kusatsu is quadruple track, the two outside rail lines (outside line) are for express trains and cargo trains, the inside two lines (inside line) are for Special Rapid trains and Local trains.

The rail track between Kyoto and Kusatsu is a quadruple track: the two outside rail lines (outside line) are for express trains and cargo trains, the inside two lines (inside line) are for Special Rapid trains and local trains.

The rail track between Kyoto and Kusatsu is a quadruple track: the two outside rail lines (outer lines) are for higher-category trains and freight trains, the inside two lines (inner lines) are for Special Rapid trains and local trains.
sen.cmt: 外側線、内側線をそれぞれouter line, inner lineとしました。 優等列車、貨物列車も、既出記事と統一し、higher-category trains, freight trainsとしました。

sen.j: 京都～米原間の全線で130km/h運転可能であり、特に京都～草津間は内側線も130km/h対応している。
sen.e: In the whole lines between Kyoto and Maibara the trains run 130km/hour and the trains operated inside lines between Kyoto and Kusatsu also run 130km/hour.
In the whole lines between Kyoto and Maibara the trains run at 130km/hour and the trains operating on the inside lines between Kyoto and Kusatsu also run at 130km/hour.
In the whole lines between Kyoto and Maibara the trains run at 130 km/hour and the trains operating on the inner lines between Kyoto and Kusatsu also run at 130 km/hour.
sen.cmt: 外側線、内側線をそれぞれouter line, inner lineとしました。

sen.j: 大津・瀬田・南草津・栗東・守山・篠原・稲枝・南彦根は絶対信号を持たない停留所である。
sen.e: There are absolutely no traffic lights at Otsu Station, Seta Station, Minami-Kusatsu Station, Ritto Station, Moriyama Station, Shinohara Station, Inae Station and Minami-hikone Station.
There are absolutely no traffic lights at Otsu Station, Seta Station, Minami-Kusatsu Station, Ritto Station, Moriyama Station, Shinohara Station, Inae Station and Minami-hikone Station.

The following stations are those that do not have absolute lights; Otsu Station, Seta Station, Minami-Kusatsu Station, Ritto Station, Moriyama Station, Shinohara Station, Inae Station and Minami-Hikone Station
sen.cmt: Minami-Hikone としました。 絶対信号＝absolute signal

sen.j: 能登川で上り、近江八幡で下り、野洲で上りがそれぞれ緩急接続が行えるほか、河瀬・安土に中線があり普通電車の特急待避や折り返しに使用される。
sen.e: Each trains going uptown at Notogawa Station and Yasu Station, the one going downtown at Omi-hachiman Station, have connections to Local and Limited express trains, the inside line at Kawase Station and Azuchi Station are used for siding of Limited express trains or shuttle trains.

Each train going uptown at Notogawa Station and Yasu Station, as well as the ones going downtown at Omi-hachiman Station, connects to local and limited express trains; accordingly, the inside line at Kawase Station and Azuchi Station are used for the siding of limited express trains or shuttle trains.

Each train going inbound at Notogawa Station and Yasu Station, as well as the ones going outbound at Omi-Hachiman Station, connects to local and limited express trains; accordingly, the inside line at Kawase Station and Azuchi Station are used for local trains waiting for limited express trains, or for shuttle trains.
sen.cmt: Omi-Hachimanとしました。上り、下りを修正

sen.j: 野洲には車両基地（京都総合運転所京都総合運転所野洲派出所）があり、221系・223系電車などが休む姿が見られる。
sen.e: There are train depot (Kyoto Comprehensive Operation Office Yasu Police station) where series 221 and 223 trains are kept.
There is a train depot (Kyoto Comprehensive Operation Office Yasu Police station) where series 221 and 223 trains are kept.
There is a train depot (Kyoto Comprehensive Operation Office Yasu Branch) where series 221 and 223 trains are kept.
sen.cmt: 野洲派出所はYasu Branchとしました。

sen.j: 全区間で阪和線運行管理システムが導入されている。
sen.e: In all sectors Hanwa Line operation control system is being used.
In all sections, the Hanwa Line operation control system is being used.
In all sections, the Hanwa Line operation control system is being used.

sen.j: 琵琶湖線のすべての駅でJスルー・ICOCA、東日本旅客鉄道（JR東日本）のSuica、東海旅客鉄道（JR東海）のTOICA、またスルッとKANSAI協議会のPiTaPaが使用できる。
sen.e: In all station of Biwako Line, J-through, ICOCA, Suica of East Japan Railway Company (JR East), TOICA of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) and PiTaPa of SURRUTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION are available.

The J-through, ICOCA, Suica of East Japan Railway Company (JR East), TOICA of the Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) and PiTaPa of SURRUTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION are available at all stations of the Biwako Line.

The J-through, ICOCA, Suica of East Japan Railway Company (JR East), TOICA of the Central Japan Railway Company (JR Tokai) and PiTaPa of Surutto KANSAI Association can be used at all stations of the Biwako Line.
sen.cmt: Surutto KANSAI Associationとしました can be usedとしました。

sen.j: 琵琶湖線の運行系統は基本的にJR京都線・JR神戸線と一体で組まれている。
sen.e: The running form of Biwako Line is basically operated together with JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line.
The running form of the Biwako Line is basically operated together with JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line.
The running form of the Biwako Line is basically operated together with the JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line.
sen.cmt: "JR Kyoto Line"→"the JR Kyoto Line"に変更しました。

sen.j: 優等列車のほか、新快速や快速列車（琵琶湖線内では普通列車）がJR京都線・JR神戸線から直通運転している。
sen.e: There is direct operating trains such as Rapid train, Special Rapid and Rapid train (Local trains in Biwako Line) are running from JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line.
There are direct operating trains such as Rapid train, Special Rapid and Rapid train (local trains on the Biwako Line) that run from the JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line.
There are direct operating trains such as higher-category train, Special Rapid and Rapid train (running as a local train within the Biwako Line) that run from the JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line.

tit.cmt: 既出記事と優等列車の表記を統一

sen.j: 北陸方面への特別急行列車は山科駅から湖西線に入るので、JR京都線と比べると本数は少ない。
sen.e: There are not many Limited Express train available going towards Hokuriku compare to JR Kyoto Line, as they enter from Yamashina Station to Kosei Line.
There aren't many limited express trains available going toward Hokuriku compared to the JR Kyoto Line, since they enter the Kosei Line from Yamashina Station.
There aren't many limited express trains available going toward Hokuriku compared to the JR Kyoto Line, since they enter the Kosei Line from Yamashina Station.

sen.j: 定期で運転される列車は以下の通りである。
sen.e: The following trains are run regularly.
The following trains are run regularly.
The following trains are run regularly.

sen.j: 特急「はるか」「びわこエクスプレス」はラッシュ時に、夜行列車の寝台特急・急行列車は深夜・早朝に運転される。
sen.e: The Airport Express 'Haruka' and Limited Express 'Biwako Express' run during rush hour and Overnight train service, Express train run in mid night and early morning.
The Haruka Airport Express and the limited 'Biwako Express' run during rush hour and overnight train service, while express trains run in the overnight and early morning hours.
The Airport Express 'Haruka' and the Limited Express 'Biwako Express' run during rush hour, while overnight train service and express trains run late at night and early morning hours.

Airport Express 'Haruka' (Maibara, Kusatsu - Kansai Airport)

Limited Express 'Hida' (Takayama - Osaka)
Limited Express 'Hida' (Takayama - Osaka)

sen.j: ちなみに、特急を琵琶湖線内だけ利用した場合、新幹線を使うよりも特急料金が高い。
sen.e: It is more reasonable to use Limited Express train within Biwako Line rather than using bullet train.
It is more reasonable to use the limited express train within the Biwako Line rather than using the Shinkansen bullet train.
In case of using the limited express train only within the Biwako Line, it is less reasonable because the express train fee is more expensive than that of the Shinkansen.

sen.j: 新快速はJR神戸線姫路・山陽本線網干・上郡・赤穂線播州赤穂方面からJR京都線を経て琵琶湖線長浜・北陸本線近江塩津駅・敦賀まで直通運転している。
sen.e: The Special Rapid train runs directly from Himeji of JR Kobe Line, Aboshi and Kamigori of Sanyo Main Line, Banshu Ako Station of Ako Line via Kyoto Station and through to Nagahama Station of Biwako Line and Omi-shiotsu Station, Tsuruga Station of Hokuriku Main Line.

The Special Rapid train runs directly from Himeji of the JR Kobe Line, Aboshi and Kamigori of the Sanyo Main Line, Banshu Ako Station of the Ako Line via Kyoto Station and through to Nagahama Station of the Biwako Line and Omi-shiotsu Station, and Tsuruga Station of the Hokuriku Main Line.

The Special Rapid train runs directly from Himeji of the JR Kobe Line, Aboshi and Kamigori of the Sanyo Main Line, Banshu Ako Station of the Ako Line via JR Kyoto Line and through to Nagahama Station of the Biwako Line and Omi-Shiotsu Station and Tsuruga Station of the Hokuriku Main Line.
sen.cmt: San'yo,JR Kyoto Lineとしました。"San'yo"→"Sanyo"に変更しました。

sen.j: 昼間はJR京都線で毎時4本運転されているが、そのうち1本は山科から湖西線に入るため、琵琶湖線に入る新快速は3本、かつ野洲以東は毎時2本になる。
sen.e: During the day there are four Special Rapid trains per hour run from Kyoto Line, as one of them will run into Kose Line from Yamashina, there are three Special Rapid trains go into Biwako Line and two trains run to east of Yasu.

During the day there are four Special Rapid trains per hour running from the Kyoto Line: as one of them will run into he Kose Line from Yamashina, there are three Special Rapid trains going into the Biwako Line and two trains running to the east of Yasu.

During the day there are four Special Rapid trains per hour running on the JR Kyoto Line; since one of them runs into the Kosei Line from Yamashina, there are three Special Rapid trains going into the Biwako Line, two of which running to the east of Yasu.

sen.j: 夕方以降は野洲まで4本運転される。
sen.e: There are four Special Rapid trains running towards Yasu since evening.
There are four Special Rapid trains running toward Yasu, starting in the evening.
There are four Special Rapid trains running toward Yasu, starting in the evening.

sen.j: 朝には草津・野洲以西が新快速、以東は普通で運転される電車もある。
sen.e: In the morning there are some Special Rapid trains operating west of Kusatsu and Yasu, and local trains run on eastern side.
In the morning there are some Special Rapid trains operating west of Kusatsu and Yasu, while local trains run on the eastern side.
In the morning there are some Special Rapid trains operating west of Kusatsu and Yasu, while there are some local trains running on the eastern side.

sen.j: 一部列車を除き京都～草津間は内側線を走る。
sen.e: Except for some trains, most of the the trains run inside line between Kyoto and Kusatsu.
Except for some trains, most run the inside line between Kyoto and Kusatsu.
Except for some trains, most run on the inner line between Kyoto and Kusatsu.

sen.j: 米原以北はホーム有効長の関係で長浜発着は8両編成、敦賀・近江塩津発着は4両編成で運転される（12両運転の場合は米原で分割・併合を行う）。
sen.e: Due to the active length of the platform, trains departing and arriving from Nagahama Station are eight car train, the ones departing and arriving from Tsuruga Station, Omi-Shiotsu Station is four car train. (The twelve car trains are divided or convened at Maibara.)

Due to the active length of the platform, trains departing and arriving from Nagahama Station are eight-car trains, while the ones departing and arriving from Tsuruga Station, Omi-Shiotsu Station are four-car trains (the 12-car trains are divided or convened at Maibara).

Due to the active length of the platform, trains departing from and arriving at Nagahama Station are eight-car trains, while the ones departing from and arriving at Tsuruga Station and Omi-Shiotsu Station are four-car trains (the 12-car trains are divided or convened at Maibara).

sen.j: 2006年10月21日のダイヤ改正からそれまでの長浜発着の一部の電車が近江塩津・敦賀まで延長された。
sen.e: Due to the change of train time table on 21st October 2006, some trains departing and arriving from Nagahama Station were extended to run to Omi-Shiotsu Station and Tsuruga Station.
Due to the change of the train timetable on October 21, 2006, some trains departing and arriving from Nagahama Station were extended to run to Omi-Shiotsu Station and Tsuruga Station.
Due to the change of the train timetable on October 21, 2006, some trains departing from and arriving at Nagahama Station were extended to run to Omi-Shiotsu Station and Tsuruga Station.
sen.cmt: arrive at and depart fromとしました。

sen.j: 全列車JR西日本223系電車1000番台及びJR西日本223系電車2000番台電車で運転される。
sen.e: All the trains run by JR (West) Suburban Trains Series 221, No. 1000 or JR (West) Suburban Trains Series 223 line, No.2000.
All the trains run by JR (West) are Suburban Train Series 221, No. 1000 or JR (West) Suburban Train Series 223 line, No. 2000.
All the trains are JR (West) Suburban Train Series 223, model No.1000s, or JR (West) Suburban Train Series 223, model No.2000s.

sen.j: 琵琶湖線の普通電車はそのほとんどがJR京都線からJR神戸線へと直通し、高槻以西（朝と深夜は京都以西）を快速運転している。
sen.e: Most of the Local trains of Biwako Line run as through trains between JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line, also they run as Rapid trains west part of Takatsuki Station. (west part of Kyoto in the morning and mid night)

Most local trains of the Biwako Line run as through-trains between the JR Kyoto Line and the JR Kobe Line, but they also run as Rapid trains for stops west of Takatsuki Station (the western part of Kyoto in the morning and a midnight).

Most local trains of the Biwako Line run as through-trains between the JR Kyoto Line and the JR Kobe Line, but they also run as Rapid trains for stops west of Takatsuki Station (the western part of Kyoto in the morning and a midnight).

sen.j: 早朝・深夜にはJR京都線に入らず、京都始発・終着の列車もある。
sen.e: The trains do not enter JR Kyoto Line in the morning and midnight, there are some trains arrives and departs of Kyoto Station.
The trains don't enter the JR Kyoto Line in the morning and midnight, but there are some trains arriving and departing at Kyoto Station.
The trains don't enter the JR Kyoto Line early in the morning and at midnight, and there are also some trains arriving at and departing from Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: arrive at and depart fromとしました。

sen.j: 多くは米原や途中の野洲発着で運転されるほか、一部は大垣や長浜まで運転される。
sen.e: Many trains arrives and departs from Maibara Station or Yasu Station, which is half way through, and the others run through to Ogaki Station or Nagahama Station.
Many trains arrive and depart from Maibara Station or Yasu Station, which is halfway through, while others run through to Ogaki Station or Nagahama Station.
Many trains arrive at and depart from Maibara Station or Yasu Station, which is halfway through, while others run through to Ogaki Station or Nagahama Station.
sen.cmt: arrive at and depart fromとしました。

sen.j: 列車の一部は草津・野洲で新快速に変わる（あるいは新快速から変わる）ものもある。
sen.e: Part of the train run as Special Rapid (or change from Special Rapid train) from Kusatsu Station and Yasu Station.
Part of the train run as a Special Rapid (or changed from a Special Rapid train) from Kusatsu Station and Yasu Station.
Part of the train is changed to a Special Rapid train (or changed from a Special Rapid train) from Kusatsu Station and Yasu Station.

sen.j: 草津～京都間は内側線運転。
sen.e: The rains run on the inside line between Kusatsu Station and Kyoto Station.
The rains run on the inside line between Kusatsu Station and Kyoto Station.
The trains run on the inner line between Kusatsu Station and Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 2008年3月のダイヤ改正より、日中下り普通電車の近江八幡での新快速待ち合わせが無くなり、米原を発車すると京都まで先着するダイヤに改められた。
sen.e: After the change of train time table in March 2008, the local trains used to wait for Special Rapid trains at Omi-hachiman Station in daytime, they now depart from Maibara Station and arrive at Kyoto Station before Special Rapid trains.

After the change of the train timetable in March 2008, the local trains would wait for Special Rapid trains at Omi-hachiman Station in the daytime, but they now depart from Maibara Station and arrive at Kyoto Station before the Special Rapid trains.

After the change of the train timetable in March 2008, the outbound local trains during the daytime do not wait for Special Rapid trains at Omi-Hachiman Station, and they now arrive at Kyoto Station first after departing from Maibara Station.
sen.cmt: 一部文修正 下りをoutbound

sen.j: 朝晩に下りは近江八幡、上りは野洲で新快速の緩急接続を受けるものがある。
sen.e: In the morning and evening, there are some Local trains connecting to Special Rapid trains at Omi-Hachiman Station for going down town, at Yasu Station for going uptown.
In the morning and evening there are some local trains connecting to Special Rapid trains at Omi-Hachiman Station headed downtown, or at Yasu Station headed uptown.
In the morning and evening some outbound trains connect with Special Rapid trains at Omi-Hachiman Station, or some inbound trains connect with Special Rapid trains at Yasu Station.

sen.j: 日中以降の野洲着新快速では米原（以遠）行き普通電車に乗り継ぎが可能である。
sen.e: There are connecting Local trains available going further than Maibara Station after the Special Rapid trains terminate at Yasu Station at night time.
There are connecting local trains available going further than Maibara Station after the Special Rapid trains terminate at Yasu Station during the nighttime.
There are connecting local trains available going further than Maibara Station after the Special Rapid trains terminate at Yasu Station from evening hours.

sen.j: JR西日本221系電車・223系（1000番台・2000番台・JR西日本223系電車6000番台 （網干車））電車（いずれも網干総合車両所所属車）の6・8・10・12両編成で運転される。
sen.e: These are six, eight, ten and twelve car trains of JR (West) Suburban Trains Series 221 (No. 1000 and 2000) and Series 223. (both Aboshi trains) (both belong to Total Quality Management Centre Aboshi Vehicle.)

These are six-, eight-, 10- and 12-car trains of JR (West) Suburban Train Series 221 (No. 1000 and 2000) and Series 223 (both of which are Aboshi trains belonging to Total Quality Management Centre Aboshi Vehicle).

These are six-, eight-, 10- and 12-car trains of JR (West) Suburban Train Series 221 (model No.1000s and 2000s) and Series 223, model No. 6000s (Aboshi Trains). (both of them belong to the Aboshi General Rolling Stock Station.)
sen.cmt: 既出のjr京都線と合わせました。

sen.j: 平日朝の京都分割の野洲ゆきと米原発草津行き電車は4両の短編成である。
sen.e: The trains going to Yasu Station, which divides at Kyoto Station and the ones depart from Maibara Station to Kusatsu Station, are four car trains run in the morning of weekdays.
The trains going to Yasu Station, which divides at Kyoto Station, and the ones departing from Maibara Station to Kusatsu Station, are four-car trains run in the morning on weekdays.
The trains going to Yasu Station, which divides at Kyoto Station, and the ones departing from Maibara Station to Kusatsu Station, are four-car trains run in the morning on weekdays.

sen.j: 乗務員などは列車番号の末尾を取って「T電」と呼ぶ場合がある（高槻～京都間快速運転の場合の列車番号末尾は平日M、休日Kである。
sen.e: These trains are called 'T-train' by the train crew as the last letter of the train number is 'T'. (The last letter of the train numbers for Express trains between Takatsuki Station and Kyoto Station is M for weekdays and K for weekends.)

These trains are called 'T-trains' by the train crew since the last letter of the train number is 'T' (the last letter of the train numbers for express trains between Takatsuki Station and Kyoto Station is M for weekdays and K for weekends).

These trains are called 'T-trains' by the train crew since the last letter of the train number is T. (The last letter of the train numbers for Rapid trains between Takatsuki Station and Kyoto Station is M for weekdays and K for weekends.

sen.j: これらもまとめてT電と呼んだり、平日M＝M電、休日K＝K電と呼んでいる）。
sen.e: These are also called T-train, weekday trains are called M-train and the weekend trains are called K-train.
These are also called T-trains, while weekday trains are called M-train and the weekend trains are called K-trains.
These are also called T-trains, while weekday trains are called M-trains and the weekend trains are called K-trains.)

sen.j: 京都から草津線に直通する列車も朝夕に設定されており、京都総合車両所所属の国鉄117系電車・国鉄113系電車電車も使われている。
sen.e: There are some direct trains from Kyoto Station to Kusatsu Station in the morning and evening, the trains used are JNR/JR Suburban Trains Series 117 and JNR/JR Suburban Trains Series 113 belong to Kyoto Comprehensive Train Depot.)

There are some direct trains from Kyoto Station to Kusatsu Station in the morning and evening: the trains used are JNR/JR Suburban Train Series 117 and JNR/JR Suburban Train Series 113 belonging to Kyoto Comprehensive Train Depot).

There are some direct trains from Kyoto Station to Kusatsu Station in the morning and evening: the trains used are JNR/JR Suburban Train Series 117 and JNR/JR Suburban Train Series 113 belonging to Kyoto General Rolling Stock Station.
sen.cmt: General Rolling Stock Stationとしました

sen.j: 草津線・湖西線直通の普通電車の中には草津～京都間外側線を走るものがある。
sen.e: Some local trains have direct connection to Kusatsu Line and Kosei Line, run the outside line between Kusatsu Station and Kyoto Station.
Some local trains have direct connections to the Kusatsu Line and Kosei Line, running the outside line between Kusatsu Station and Kyoto Station.
Some local trains have direct connections to the Kusatsu Line and Kosei Line, running the outer line between Kusatsu Station and Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 平日のみ、朝晩には、西明石・新三田～草津・野洲間で4ドア車（JR西日本207系電車・JR西日本321系電車電車）による普通電車（京阪神緩行線）も運行されている。
sen.e: The local four door trains (Keihan Shinkanko Line) (JR (West) Suburban Trains Series 270 and 321) run in the morning and evening on weekdays between Nishiakashi Station and Shinsanda Station - Kusatsu Station and Yasu Station.

The local four-door trains (Keihan Shinkanko Line) (JR (West) Suburban Train Series 270 and 321) run in the morning and evening on weekdays between Nishiakashi Station and Shinsanda Station - Kusatsu Station and Yasu Station.
The local four-door trains (Keihanshin Kanko Line) (JR (West) Suburban Train Series 207 and 321) run in the morning and evening on weekdays between Nishi-Akashi/Shinsanda and Kusatsu/Yasu.

sen.j: 列車番号末尾は、平日C（休日Bだが、休日の琵琶湖線内の運転はなし）である（こちらはまとめてC電と呼ばれている）。
sen.e: The last letter of the train number is C for weekday train (B for weekends train however no trains run within Biwako Line on weekends.)
The last letter of the train number is C for a weekday train (B for a weekend train, despite the fact that no trains run within the Biwako Line on weekends).
The last letter of the train number is C for a weekday train (B for a weekend train, despite the fact that no trains run within the Biwako Line on weekends).

sen.j: なお、山科～京都間は湖西線の新快速電車・普通電車も走っている。
sen.e: There are Special Rapid trains of Kosei Line running between Yamashina Station and Kyoto Station.
There are Special Rapid trains of the Kosei Line running between Yamashina Station and Kyoto Station.
There are Special Rapid trains and the local trains of the Kosei Line running between Yamashina Station and Kyoto Station.

sen.j: これについては湖西線を参照のこと。
sen.e: Please refer to Kosei Line for the details.
Please refer to Kosei Line for details.
Please refer to Kosei Line for details.

sen.j: 山科～京都間に新駅を設置する構想がある。
sen.e: There is a future plan to build new station between Yamashina Station and Kyoto Station. Cite web
There is a future plan to build a new station between Yamashina Station and Kyoto Station. Cite web
There is a future plan to build a new station between Yamashina Station and Kyoto Station.
